block.p: An oyster festival sponsored by Guinness, the traditional quaff for oysters in Ireland, will include a Galway-style shucking contest and food for sale and will take place on Saturday from noon to 9 p.m. at East Fourth and Lafayette Streets. The event will benefit the Merchant's House Museum, 29 East Fourth Street.

The event will benefit the Merchant's House Museum, 29 East Fourth Street.

The Brooklyn Botanic Garden's annual chili pepper festival will be held on Saturday from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Admission to the garden is $3 for adults; $1.50 for students and those 65 and over; free for children under 16. Information: (718) 623-7333.

The Central New Jersey chapter of Slow Food, an international organization dedicated to the preservation of culinary traditions, has organized a harvest festival for Sunday from 1 to 6 p.m. at Tre Piani restaurant in the Forrestal Village shopping center in Princeton, N.J. There will be cooking demonstrations and food for sale. Admission is $15 for members of Slow Food, $25 for nonmembers.

Brooklyn Eats, a food festival with samples from restaurants in the borough, will be held on Oct. 12 from 6:30 to 8:30 p.m. at the New York Marriott Brooklyn, 333 Adams Street in downtown Brooklyn. Tickets are $50 in advance from (212) 239-6200; $65 at the door.

A Barolo dinner at the Four Seasons restaurant, 99 East 52nd Street, will be held on Oct. 23 at 6:30 p.m. Six courses and more than a dozen Barolos will be served at the event, which honors Pio Boffa of Pio Cesare winery. Tickets are $250; (212) 754-9494.
